a.title: Go to comments for Letter to the Parents

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: On Monday, April 20, 2020, meals will be available CURBSIDE at Greene County High School from 11:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. Multiple meals will be included and available for pick-up. Meals will be available for pick-up in Boligee, Tishabee and Forkland at the normal delivery time and locations. THIS IS THE ONLY DAY THAT MEALS WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR PICK-UP THIS WEEK. We will send an update at a later date when the next meals will be available. We look forward to serving you and as always, be safe.

a.title: Go to comments for Curbside Meal Delivery

img.title: Greene County Board of Education April Board Meeting
img.alt: Greene County Board of Education April Board Meeting

a.title: Go to comments for Greene County Board of Education April Board Meeting

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p:
Greene County Schools is one of 137 school districts in the state of Alabama. We are located in beautiful rural west-central Alabama between the Tombigbee and Black Warrior Rivers, and easily accessible by Interstates 59/20 and US Highways 11 & 43.
We are delighted that you are visiting our website and hope that the information provided is informative and helpful. Here at the Greene County Board of Education our motto is “One Vision, One Voice, One Victory...Inspiring Every Student to Succeed” where we believe that together we will accomplish great things with and for our children. Our school system has four traditional schools: Greene County High School (9 – 12), Robert Brown Middle School (4 – 8), Eutaw Primary School (K – 3) and Greene County Career Center (9 – 12). Our Alternative Learning Academy is located on the campus of Peter J Kirksey AVC. You are encouraged to visit each school's website for detailed specific information pertinent to programs of operation and activities.
Our school system has made exceptional progress within the past few years as we focus on College and Career Readiness standards. With community support, we built a new high school with gymnasium and career center. Again, welcome to our website!

h1.aria-label: Report Cards Mailed the Week of April 8th
h1.span: Report Cards Mailed the Week of April 8th

div.p: Report cards for the Greene County School District were mailed earlier this week. Please make sure that you have received a report card/cards for your child/children. Thank you and be safe.
